Package oracle.kubernetes.operator.work

Class NextAction

java.lang.Object
oracle.kubernetes.operator.work.NextAction
public final class NextAction
extends java.lang.Object
Indicates what shall happen after Step.apply(Packet) returns.

To allow reuse of this object, this class is mutable.

    • terminate

      public void terminate​(java.lang.Throwable t, Packet p)

      Parameters:
      t - Throwable
      p - Packet

    • suspend

      public void suspend​(java.util.function.Consumer<AsyncFiber> onExit)
      Indicates that the fiber should be suspended. Once the current Thread exits the fiber's control loop, the onExit will be invoked. This Consumer may call Fiber.resume(Packet); however it is still guaranteed that the current Thread will return control, therefore, further processing will be handled on a Thread from the Executor. For synchronous cases, the Thread invoking this fiber cannot return until fiber processing is complete; therefore, the guarantee is only that the onExit will be invoked prior to completing the suspension.
      Parameters:
      onExit - Called once the fiber is suspended

    • suspend

      public void suspend​(Step next, java.util.function.Consumer<AsyncFiber> onExit)
      Indicates that the fiber should be suspended. Once the current Thread exits the fiber's control loop, the onExit will be invoked. This Consumer may call Fiber.resume(Packet); however it is still guaranteed that the current fiber will return control, therefore, further processing will be handled on a Thread from the Executor. Once resumed, resume with the Step.apply(Packet) on the given next step.
      Parameters:
      next - Next step
      onExit - Will be invoked after the fiber suspends

    • delay

      public void delay​(Step next, Packet p, long delay, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
      Indicates that the fiber should be suspended for the indicated delay duration and then automatically resumed.

      Once resumed, resume with the Step.apply(Packet) on the given next step.

      Parameters:
      next - Next step
      p - Packet to use when invoking Step.apply(Packet) on next step
      delay - Delay time
      unit - Delay time unit
